title: How electricity-eating microbes use electrons to fix carbon dioxide

title_detail.value: How electricity-eating microbes use electrons to fix carbon dioxide

summary: A phototrophic microbe called Rhodopseudomonas palustris takes up electrons from conductive substances like metal oxides or rust to reduce carbon dioxide.

summary_detail.value: A phototrophic microbe called Rhodopseudomonas palustris takes up electrons from conductive substances like metal oxides or rust to reduce carbon dioxide.
